Course Description: A COURSE DESIGNED TO PROVIDE TRAINING IN A STUDENTS FIELD OF STUDY THROUGH WORK EXPERIENCE. STUDENTS ARE GRADED ON THE BASIS OF (3) LEARNING OBJECTIVES, MID-TERM PROJECT, END-OF-TERM PROJECT, AND EMPLOYER EVALUATION. COURSE MAY BE REPEATED THREE TIMES. PREREQUISITE: INTERNSHIP EDGE DEPARTMENT APPROVAL. STUDENTS WILL BE ASSIGNED SPECIFIC COURSE PREFIXES RELATED TO THEIR ACADEMIC MAJOR PRIOR TO REGISTRATION. ALL STUDENTS MUST SIGN UP FOR A MANDATORY INTERNSHIP ORIENTATION TO BEGIN THE INTERNSHIP PROCESS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major: THE LEARNING OUTCOMES VARY. FACULTY WILL CREATE THEM BASED ON THE STUDENTS INTERNSHIP ASSIGNMENT.
